ComicInfo.Title: The Prisoner of Pan-Tang; Childsong; Why Viking Lander/Mars?; Chapter Two: Zeus and Prometheus; Out of Space, Out of Time
ComicInfo.Summary:
The great science fiction/fantasy anthology series continues with one of the earliest comic book adaptations of Michael Moorcock's Elric.
1) Editorial: Friedrich (1 page text article)
2) Elric Of Melnibone: The Prisoner Of Pan Tang: Kimball, Gould (20 pages) (adapted from the works of Michael Moorcock)
3) Childsong: Petras, Day, Leialoha (3 pages)
4) The Gods Of MountOlympus In Ancient Mythology: Zeus And Prometheus: Achziger, Staton (15 pages)
5) Out Of Space, Out Of Time: Lyda (8 pages)
*The cover painting by the legendary Jeff Jones is an excellent rendering of Michael Moorcock's Elric, using fellow artist Bernie Wrightson as a model. Because this story was sent to Friedrich unsolicited, he had to obtain Moorcock's permission to run it in this issue. This began a long collaboration of Friedrich overseeing adaptations of Moorcock's works across many comics publishers.
ComicInfo.Notes: Tagged with the ninjas.walk.alone fork of ComicTagger 1.3.5 using info from Comic Vine on 2024-06-16 10:26:54. [CVDB16801]

ComicInfo.Penciller: Bob Gould, Gene Day, Alex Niño, Joe Staton, Gray Lyda, Gene Day, Gray Lyda, Jeff Jones, Joe Staton
ComicInfo.Inker: Bob Gould, Steve Leialoha, Alex Niño, Joe Staton, Gray Lyda, Gene Day, Gray Lyda, Jeff Jones, Joe Staton
ComicInfo.Letterer: Tom Orzechowski, Joe Staton, Gray Lyda
ComicInfo.Characters: Athena, Atlas, Elric, Epimetheus, Hephaestus, Hercules, Hermes, Homer, Pandora, Prometheus, Zeus
ComicInfo.Teams: Gods of Olympus, Titans of Myth
